sentences.sContent: He was also partly responsible for the identification of the polio virus, and made numerous contributions to immunology, histology and anatomy.
sentences.sContent_eng: He was also partly responsible for the identification of the polio virus, and made numerous contributions to immunology, histology and anatomy.
sentences.sCn: 同时，他还参与了脊髓灰质炎病毒的鉴定，在免疫学、组织学和解剖学上都有贡献。

sentences.sContent: The staining method Golgi discovered was of vital significance; using that method, he laid the foundations of the discipline we now call histology.
sentences.sContent_eng: The staining method Golgi discovered was of vital significance; using that method, he laid the foundations of the discipline we now call histology.
sentences.sCn: 另外，高尔基染色法也具有重要的意义，正是因为这一方法，他奠定了现代组织学的基础。

sentences.sContent: With humans, we're somewhat limited.We do this - use this technique called high-resolution MRI, which, by the way, isn't very high resolution compared to histology that we can do with animals.
sentences.sContent_eng: With humans, we're somewhat limited.We do this - use this technique called high-resolution MRI, which, by the way, isn't very high resolution compared to histology that we can do with animals.
sentences.sCn: 至于人类，我们所能做的稍稍有限，我们使用一种被称为高分辨率核磁共振成像的技术，其实和我们对动物做的组织学检查相比，这个也没多高分辨率。

words.tran: 组织胺酵素，[生化] 组胺酶
[免疫] 组织相容性；组织适合性

trans.tranOther: the study, esp the microscopic study, of the tissues of an animal or plant
